descript.abstract: This dataset is a polygon shapefile representing unassessed Mesozoic (Triassic) basins of the Eastern U.S. The shapefiles were digitized off of a printed map that was done by the Delaware Geological Survey. The scale of the map that was digitized is 1:1,000,000. The map demonstrates the maximum extent of several basins, and their qualitatively assessed potential for coal. These basins have not been quantitatively assessed by the U.S. Geological Survey.
descript.purpose: This dataset was compiled to update the Coal Fields Map of the Conterminous United States, OFR 96-092. It was included to demonstrate potential for coal basins and exploration in areas that have not previously been considered.
descript.supplinf: Sources used in the abstract and purpose include: > Benson, R. 1992. Map of Exposed and Buried Early Mesozoic Rift Basins/Synrift Rocks of the U.S. Middle Atlantic Continental Margin. Delaware Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map Series No. 5. Scale 1:1,000,000

theme.themekt: Alexandria Digital Library Feature Type Thesaurus

theme.themekey: Coal Fields Map of North America

cntperp.cntorg: U. S. Geological Survey - Eastern Energy Resources Science Center

idinfo.datacred: Technical reviews for this publication were provided by Leslie Ruppert, Christopher Garrity, Susan Tewalt, Lee Osmonson, James Luppens and James Coleman.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.0.1770

attracc.attraccr: Attribute accuracy was tested by manual comparison of the source with georeferenced digital printouts of the original publication, hard copy printouts and/or symbolized display of the digital geologic data on an interactive computer graphic system.

dataqual.logic: Map elements were visually checked for overshoots, undershoots, duplicates, polygon closure and proper attribution.
dataqual.complete: Data set complete. No data was intentionally omitted from the hard copy and digital source maps.

horizpa.horizpar: The digital file and shapefile was digitized by hand, with a RMS error not exceeding .005 when coordinating the digitizer. Visual comparison of the basins with the digital geologic map of North America displayed some offset, with the maximum being around 1 km.

citeinfo.title: Map of Exposed and Buried Early Mesozoic Rift Basins/Synrift Rocks of the U.S. Middle Atlantic Continental Margin.

serinfo.sername: Delaware Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map Series

procstep.procdesc: The Mesozoic basins shapefile was digitized by hand from the paper map Benson (1992). The coverage was projected from UTM 18 with a datum of NAD 1927 into geographic, and the datum was converted using the ESRI NADCON datum conversion. The coverage was exported as a shapefile and the polygons were populated with attributes.
procstep.srcused: D:/tully/Reboot/Mesozoic Basins/East_Coast_Mesozoic_Basin_AUs/Shapefiles/50700561_South Georgia Basin/South Georgia Basin AU

enttyp.enttypd: Polygons defining boundaries of basins that have not been quantitatively assessed for coal potential.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Potential of basin to contain measurable coal

edom.edomvd: Unknown potential of coal in the basin
Coal has been found and recorded in the basin
Coal has not been found, or found in minimal amounts in the basin
